posts.author: Valehand
posts.content:
(Yeah, I went there you wanna fight bout it?)




Alright, so I was thinking of doing a ranger type character (though, I am not sure if an Arcane Archer would be good to do as well. So, I came here)

Alright, so the name of the game is Arelith.
1) PvM or PvP: I suppose I'd want it to mainly focus on PvM, however, if it can be twisted to be 'okay'ish in a PvP situation all the better.
2) Level 30 Cap.
3) Race Preference. Elf
4) Classes Considered and why... Ranger, Wizard, AA, Fighter, Rogue Now, I would like to role-play a Ranger, but I didn't know if I would need to also put them into AA to be somewhat viable (although I love the idea of Arcane Archer and wouldn't mind it that much myself if it was benefical to Ranger) Without it, I can't seem to find the good balance on my own to not do ...5-6 damage per round (which is good at low levels, but... at 30's? Not so much)
5) Melee? Possibly dual wield, but this isn't such a big deal.
6) Dex Based, Archery is probably the best. (Suggestions otherwise are always welcome)
7) I would enjoy using a Longbow the most
8) Max enchant? I don't know, I hear some ideas can give +4 to some stats (artefacts), but they are rare. HOWEVER! Items can boost stats so say you have 23 Dex by level 30. You can boost tunics, rings, (possibly weapons) to give you +1 in any stat (to about +8 or 9) Also, works on skills so I hear, however, the more stats the more risk of the item blowing up in your face (trying to enchant it further, meaning destroyed)
9) Not necessary, in Arelith the Ranger can become an AA without the required Arcane levels put in (but it needs to meet the rest of the requirements)
10) See Note 8 about some changes. However, some class changes have taken effect I will list them at the end for reference.

Forbidden classes (Without a lot of other requirements met, RP or otherwise):
Assassin
Harper Scout
Pale Master
Red Dragon Disciple
Shifter
Purple Dragon Knight

Paths of the Ranger available to taking upon creationArcherRangers on Arelith can choose the Archer path. Such rangers lose the feats Dual-wield and Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, but can craft a bundle of iron arrows at ranger level 1, a bundle of steel arrows at ranger level 5, and a bundle of damask arrows at ranger level 10.Instead of the AC bonus at level 6, they gain +1 of damage to ranged attacks. At 14, they gain +3. This damage can not be reduced.

The Sniper path is an alternate archer path for rangers. Snipers lose the dual wield feats but get point blank shot and rapid shot at level 1 and called shot at level 9.Instead of the AC bonus at level 6, they gain +1 of damage to ranged attacks. At 14, they gain +3. This damage can not be reduced.


Changes to Ranger, Regarding AA.
Ranger does not have to fulfill the NWN Requirement of arcane Spellcasting when multiclassing to Arcane Archer. Therefore any Ranger can take levels in the Arcane Archer class without taking any levels in the Wizard, Bard or Sorcerer classes. He must still fulfill all other requirements for the class.

Any help is appreciated, and if I didn't answer something that does indeed need to be answered beforehand, I would be happy to make a response.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Sry. My bad. Missed that part where DW got traded off for the path feats.  My combo won't work, then.   Stick with Empyre's 15/15 if you want to switch to S/S.

So... let's look at your wish-list again.  

I don't see any possibility to approach anywhere near the ranged AB either finessing or DWing.

My advice: stick with PBS (@AB 47) when in melee range and kite your butt off whenever possible using leg shots to slow them.  
That means uncanny dodge to retain your exalted DEX AC which means rogue or SD levels. 
Wear robes unless you can surpass +9 plus whatever add'l you can get from Cat pots/scrolls.
SD will not lend anything to damage increase and also affords no UMD benefits.
HiPS would be handy, of course, but IMO not worth sacrificing all that the rogue class brings to the table.

So how about a highly-skilled, stealth bomber using something like Rgr3/ AA19/ Rog8?

You'd reach an AB of 46 with a +10 enchantment on your mundane arrows, naked AC of 27 with 320 HP and penetrate all DR buffs.

That's +10 damage, plus avg 15 sneak damage @rog7 and an FE per hit with junk arrows.  Seems fairly reasonable
to me especially with 5 shots per round.

Try an elven Str 12, Dex 18(28), Con 14, Int 14, Cha 8 w/any alignment

Rog 1-3 BF, WF: longbow
Rgr 4-6 FE (pick), dodge
Rog 7
AA 8-17 impcrit: longbow, SF: hide, SF: mv silent
Rog 18-20 toughness
AA 21-27 armor skin, EWF: longbow, Grt DEX x 2
Rog 28
AA 29-30 Grt Dex, Prowess

Skill ranks 242

Disable Trap 17(21), Hide 33(45), Listen 33(34), Move Silently 33(45),
Open Lock 1(10), Set Trap 5(16), Spellcraft 13(15), Spot 33(34), Tumble 30(39), UMD 31(30)

In this build, detection is good and stealth is even better.  You should get lots and lots of sneak opportunities.

Good enough to recover and set all deadly traps except gas and open locks up to DC 30 but reallocate those 23 ranks if not interested in rogue skills.
Did I mention the advantages of a high UMD skill?  BTW, assuming Arelith uses hardcore scroll check, if your toon uses an Eagle pot before
reading high-level scrolls, there is an excellent chance the cast will not fail at modified 31-32.

posts.content: My build gives you +8 attack and damage with your longbow. If you had, for example, +3 arrows, the +3 damage from the arrows would be added to the +8 from AA (they stack), the same goes for the attack bonus from a +X bow.
